content.content: I sort of let myself get dragged into some Twitter threads today, and we’re just covering ground that I feel like I’ve already talked about many times. I updated my Funding Experiments page on the EthWiki. It is editable by anyone, but it right now mainly is just me / my point of view. Meaning: please do edit / annotate / add links & resources etc – and we can use this thread more for discussion. I think the Ethereum Stack is still the best, most adopted, most shipping blockchain stack there is. And I wish the ecosystem could improve more and more quickly. This mainly requires an investment of dedicated people time, and to get those dedicated people they’re going to have to get funded to work on various aspects full time. Or not, and things will improve more slowly or not at all.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post discusses the need for dedicated people to improve the Ethereum Stack and how funding is necessary to achieve this. The author invites others to edit and add to their Funding Experiments page on EthWiki and encourages discussion on the topic. The post also invites constructive criticism and questions about the proposal, and expresses a desire for collaboration.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: I posted this here precisely to not have to re-answer the same questions multiple times on Twitter.
Hi. This currently redirects to Home | ethereum.org which I am not sure if the original was this one Ethereum Foundation & community grant programs | ethereum.org ?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
